description: The `Static Analysis & Code Graph Generator` subsystem is designed with a clear pipeline architecture, orchestrating various specialized components to perform deep code analysis and construct comprehensive code graphs.

components.name: Orchestration Engine
components.description: Serves as the main entry point and coordinator for the entire static analysis workflow. It initializes and manages other components, orchestrates the sequence of analysis steps (scanning, LSP interaction, graph building, result storage), and integrates the outputs from various stages.

components.name: Project Scanner
components.description: Scans the project directory to detect programming languages, their file types, and overall code statistics. It also builds and manages language-specific configurations required for subsequent analysis steps, such as LSP server initialization.

components.name: Language Configuration Manager
components.description: Specializes in scanning and parsing language-specific project configuration files (e.g., Maven `pom.xml`, Gradle `build.gradle`, TypeScript `tsconfig.json`). It also provides utilities for setting up and managing language-specific environments, such as detecting Java installations and configuring the Java Development Tools Language Server (JDTLS).

components.name: LSP Client Manager
components.description: Manages the lifecycle and communication with Language Server Protocol (LSP) servers. It provides a generic LSP client for fundamental interactions and specialized clients for languages like Java and TypeScript to extract detailed code intelligence (symbols, definitions, references, call hierarchies) from source code.

components.name: Code Graph Builder
components.description: Constructs a comprehensive call graph representing the relationships between functions and methods within the codebase. It applies various clustering algorithms to this graph to identify logical components and modules, and provides helper functions for managing and interpreting clustering results.

components.name: Analysis Result Store
components.description: Acts as the central storage and caching mechanism for all static analysis data. It stores extracted code intelligence (CFG, class hierarchies, references), manages persistence, and provides an interface for other components to retrieve and update analysis results efficiently.

components.name: Reference Resolver
components.description: Resolves ambiguous or incomplete code references identified during the analysis. It employs various strategies, including exact matches, file path-based resolution, and potentially heuristic or LLM-assisted methods, to link references to their correct definitions.
